metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44223 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 5.8 lacks support for the Update URI plugin header. Thismakes it easier for remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via asupply-chain attack against WordPress installations that use any plugin forwhich the slug satisfies the naming constraints of the WordPress.org PluginDirectory but is not yet present in that directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
wordpress-l10n - 5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.1+dfsg1-2ubuntu1').
